servinfo.title: Camshaft and Tappet Removal and Installation

attention3.ptxt: For identification of each cylinder, refer to Precautions for Identification of Cylinder:J24B .

s1.ptxt: Remove cylinder head cover.
Remove accessory drive belt.
Turn crankshaft clockwise with 19 mm wrench, and position piston No.1 at TDC on the compression stroke according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Align the timing mark (1) on the CMP actuator and the timing mark (2) on the exhaust camshaft timing sprocket with the match marks (3) on the camshaft housing No.1.
Align notch (1) on the crankshaft pulley with “0” (2) on the timing chain cover.

s1.ptxt: Fix timing chain tensioner according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Remove timing chain cover plug (1) and gasket (2).
Insert fore-end of special tool into timing chain cover from timing chain cover plug hole, then push special tool to timing chain.
Fix special tool by tightening bolt (1) to 8 N·m (0.82 kgf-m, 6.0 lbf-ft).

item.ptxt: Failure to observe the following cautions result it engine damage or incorrect installing of timing chain.
Use bolt (1) of M6 size and 1.00 mm (0.039 in.) pitch.
Be sure to tighten bolt (1) to 8 N·m (0.82 kgf-m, 6.0 lbf-ft). If bolt becomes loose, plunger of timing chain tensioner adjuster may extend, making it difficult to reinstall timing chain properly.
Do not turn crankshaft after timing chain is fixed with special tool.

s1.ptxt: Apply a dab of paint to two timing chain links (2) which meet timing marks (1) on CMP actuator and exhaust camshaft timing sprocket.
Remove exhaust camshaft timing sprocket according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Hold hexagonal section of exhaust camshaft using wrench or the like.
Loosen exhaust camshaft timing sprocket bolt and remove exhaust camshaft timing sprocket (1).

item.ptxt: Be careful not to drop dowel pin into the space between timing chain cover and cylinder block.
It is not needed to remove CMP actuator at this procedure.

s1.ptxt: Remove dowel pin from exhaust camshaft.
Loosen camshaft housing bolts in numerical order (“1” – “21”) evenly and gradually.
Remove intake camshaft and exhaust camshaft.
Remove camshaft bearings and tappets as necessary.
Remove CMP actuator from intake camshaft according to the following procedure if necessary.

s2.ptxt: Hold hexagonal section of intake camshaft using vice.
Loosen CMP actuator bolt and remove CMP actuator (1).

s1.ptxt: Install CMP actuator (1) to intake camshaft.
Apply engine oil to contact surface of tappets (arrow), and then install tappets (1) to cylinder head.
Install camshaft bearings according to the following procedure.

attention2.ptxt: Camshaft upper bearing half (1) is different in shape from lower bearing half (2).
Distinguish upper and lower bearing halves certainly when installing.

s2.ptxt: Fit tab (1) of camshaft bearing to groove (2) of cylinder head or camshaft housing.
Press camshaft bearing end (3) until it fully seats in cylinder head or camshaft housing.
Apply engine oil to sliding surface (4) of camshaft bearing halves.

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply engine oil between bearing halves (5) and camshaft housing or cylinder head (5).

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to sliding surfaces of camshafts, and then install camshafts to cylinder head according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Align the timing chain link (2), which is painted in removal procedure under this section, with timing mark (1) on CMP actuator and install intake camshaft.
Install exhaust camshaft and position dowel pin hole (3) of exhaust camshaft downward.

s1.ptxt: Install camshaft housings (1) to proper places distinguished by character (2), number (3) and arrow direction (4) on each camshaft housing.

entry.ptxt: Point arrowhead to timing chain side

s1.ptxt: Tighten camshaft housing bolts according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Apply engine oil to bolt thread and seat of camshaft housing bolts.
Install camshaft housing No.1 (1).
Install camshaft housing bolts, and tighten them by hand.
Tighten camshaft housing bolts in numerical order (“1” – “21”) evenly and gradually.

s1.ptxt: Install dowel pin to exhaust camshaft.

attention2.ptxt: Be careful not to drop dowel pin into the space between timing chain cover and cylinder block.

s1.ptxt: Install exhaust camshaft timing sprocket (3) to exhaust camshaft according to the following procedure.

s2.ptxt: Align timing chain link (1), which is painted in “removal” under this section, with timing mark (2) on exhaust camshaft timing sprocket (3), and loop timing chain up over exhaust camshaft timing sprocket.
Install exhaust camshaft timing sprocket (3) with timing chain to the exhaust camshaft.

s1.ptxt: Tighten exhaust camshaft timing sprocket bolt (1) using special tool.

attention2.ptxt: In case of using extension special tool combined with torque wrench, reading value of torque wrench is smaller than actual value. When using extension special tool, reading value should be calculated according to formula below.

spec.title: Formula for reading value of torque wrench.

item.ptxt: M: Reading value using extension special tool

s1.ptxt: Confirm that painted timing chain links (1) are aligned with timing marks (2) on CMP actuator and exhaust camshaft timing sprocket.
Remove special tool from timing chain cover.
Install timing chain cover plug (1) with new gasket (2), and tighten it to specified torque.
Check that camshaft and timing chain are installed properly as follows.

s2.ptxt: Check that timing mark (1) on CMP actuator and timing mark (2) on exhaust camshaft timing sprocket are aligned with match marks (3) on camshaft housing No.1.
Check that notch (1) on crankshaft pulley is aligned with “0” (2) on timing chain cover.
Turn crankshaft clockwise twice and repeat Step a) and b).

item.ptxt: Be sure to turn crankshaft fully twice. If it is once, timing marks on CMP actuator and exhaust camshaft timing sprockets do not meet match marks on camshaft housing No.1.
After turning crankshaft twice, the painted timing chain links are not aligned with the timing marks on the CMP actuator and the exhaust timing sprocket, but it is normal.

s1.ptxt: Check valve clearance.
Install cylinder head cover.
